result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A Brooke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.02(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED.   Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Continue psychiatric/psychological evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Carling Dr. No flammable items for fire setting.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

supervisions.notes:
12/4/14: Crt orders JOC be corrected to reflect that the bifurcated sentence from the 12/2/14 sentencing hrg is to be served and not imposed & stayed.
  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
